reg_info.act_under: Fairness is a Two-Way Street Act (Construction Labour Mobility), 1999

content.content: 1. (1) For the purposes of section 2 of the Act, the security posted shall be a letter of guarantee from a bank to which the Bank Act (Canada) applies or a surety bond issued by an insurer licensed under the Insurance Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 1 (1). (2) The security posted under section 2 of the Act may be used, (a) to pay a fine under the Act that the contractor is liable for but has not paid, including interest for the late payment of the fine; or (b) to recover an amount with respect to an Ontario tax that the contractor is liable for but has not paid. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) For the purposes of section 2 of the Act, the security posted shall be a letter of guarantee from a bank to which the Bank Act (Canada) applies or a surety bond issued by an insurer licensed under the Insurance Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 1 (1).

(2) The security posted under section 2 of the Act may be used,

(a) to pay a fine under the Act that the contractor is liable for but has not paid, including interest for the late payment of the fine; or

(b) to recover an amount with respect to an Ontario tax that the contractor is liable for but has not paid. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 2. (1) The Director shall not register a contractor that is a corporation under subsection 2 (2) of the Act unless the contractor provides proof that the net equity of the corporation is at least $20,000. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 2 (1). (2) The Director shall not register a contractor that is not a corporation under subsection 2 (3) of the Act unless the contractor provides proof that the contractor’s net equity is at least $10,000. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) The Director shall not register a contractor that is a corporation under subsection 2 (2) of the Act unless the contractor provides proof that the net equity of the corporation is at least $20,000. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 2 (1).

(2) The Director shall not register a contractor that is not a corporation under subsection 2 (3) of the Act unless the contractor provides proof that the contractor’s net equity is at least $10,000. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 2 (2).

content.content: 3. (1) The provisions set out in Schedule 1 are prescribed as legislation under which a contractor must be certified, registered, licensed or issued a permit or authorization for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 3 (1). (2) All of the municipalities in Ontario are prescribed for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 3 (2). (3) Section 150 of the Municipal Act, 2001 is prescribed as legislation authorizing by-laws for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 322/02, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
3. (1) The provisions set out in Schedule 1 are prescribed as legislation under which a contractor must be certified, registered, licensed or issued a permit or authorization for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 3 (1).

(2) All of the municipalities in Ontario are prescribed for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 3 (2).

(3) Section 150 of the Municipal Act, 2001 is prescribed as legislation authorizing by-laws for the purposes of subsection 5 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 322/02, s. 1.

content.content: 4. The agencies, boards and commissions set out in Schedule 2 are prescribed for the purposes of subsection 7 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. The agencies, boards and commissions set out in Schedule 2 are prescribed for the purposes of subsection 7 (2) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 4.

content.content: 5. The trades, occupations and construction activities listed in Schedule 3 are prescribed for the purposes of section 10 of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. The trades, occupations and construction activities listed in Schedule 3 are prescribed for the purposes of section 10 of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 5.

content.content: 6. For the purposes of section 11 of the Act, “aggregates” means sand, earth, gravel, stone, rock, a combination of any of them or one or a combination of any of them mixed with ingredients found in cement or asphalt. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 6.
content.raw_html:
6. For the purposes of section 11 of the Act,

“aggregates” means sand, earth, gravel, stone, rock, a combination of any of them or one or a combination of any of them mixed with ingredients found in cement or asphalt. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 6.

content.content: 7. The legislation set out in Schedule 4 is prescribed for the purposes of both clauses 16 (5) (b) and (c) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 7.
content.raw_html: 7. The legislation set out in Schedule 4 is prescribed for the purposes of both clauses 16 (5) (b) and (c) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 7.

content.content: 8. (1) Every individual who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from the Act if the individual is regularly employed by the Crown in right of Ontario or a municipality, a school board, public hospital, university or college of applied arts and technology or an industrial establishment. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (1). (2) Every construction worker who is qualified under the Interprovincial Red Seal Program and who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from subsections 10 (3) and (4) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (2). (3) Every apprentice registered in Ontario with a valid contract of apprenticeship who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from section 10 of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (3).
content.raw_html:
8. (1) Every individual who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from the Act if the individual is regularly employed by the Crown in right of Ontario or a municipality, a school board, public hospital, university or college of applied arts and technology or an industrial establishment. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (1).

(2) Every construction worker who is qualified under the Interprovincial Red Seal Program and who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from subsections 10 (3) and (4) of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (2).

(3) Every apprentice registered in Ontario with a valid contract of apprenticeship who is a person resident in a designated jurisdiction is exempt from section 10 of the Act. O. Reg. 326/99, s. 8 (3).

9. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 326/99, s. 9.

1. Section 21 of the Employer Health Tax Act.

2. Sections 5 and 6 of Regulation 213/91 under the Occupational Health and Safety Act.

3. Subsections 5 (1) and (1.1) and 39 (3) of the Retail Sales Tax Act.

O. Reg. 326/99, Sched. 1.
